greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Minimal number of c-squares (A020330) and/or 1's which add to n.
comment: Conjecture: the sequence is bounded by a constant.
example: For n=33, we have 33=15+15+3. Since 33 is not in union of {1} and c-squares and is not a sum of two such numbers, then a(33)=3.
program: (PARI) v=vector(10^5,n,n+n<<#binary(n)); \\ choose large enough that v[#v] > n for a(n) below.

a(n)=if(setsearch(v,n),return(1));if(n<3,return(n));my(where=setsearch(v,n+1,1),t=n);if(!where,where=setsearch(v,n,1));forstep(i=where-1,1,-1,t=min(w(n-v[i]),t); if(t==1,return(2))); t+1 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 10 2013
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, Dec 09 2013
